movies.title: Lie Still
movies.plot: After breaking-up with his girlfriend Veronica, the unemployed John Hare rents a cheap room in an old boarding house owned by the nice Martin Stone and the landlord tells him that the house is crowded by discreet persons. John does not see any other tenant but a bizarre old woman in the house and during the nights, he sees weird things on his television and hears violent knocks on his door. When John calls Veronica, she notes that he is near a breakdown after many sleepless nights and decides to stay with him. However, Veronica vanishes during the night, leading John to an ultimate decision.
movies.simplePlot: After breaking-up with his girlfriend Veronica, the unemployed John Hare rents a cheap room in an old boarding house owned by the nice Martin Stone and the landlord tells him that the house...

biography.bio: Tim Barlow was born on January 18, 1936 in Blackpool, Lancashire, England as Michael John Leigh Barlow. He is an actor, known for Les Misérables (1998), Hot Fuzz (2007) and 10,000 BC (2008).
biography.name: Tim Barlow

biography.bio: Robert Blythe is an actor, known for The Englishman Who Went Up a Hill But Came Down a Mountain (1995), The Theory of Flight (1998) and Darklands (1996).
biography.name: Robert Blythe

biography.bio: Susan Engel was born on March 25, 1935 in Vienna, Austria. She is an actress, known for The Cedar Tree (1976), Damage (1992) and King Lear (1971). She has been married to Sylvester Morand since 1968. They have one child.
biography.name: Susan Engel

biography.bio: Stuart Laing was born on November 28, 1969 in London, England. He is an actor, known for EastEnders (1985), Butterfly Man (2002) and South West 9 (2001).
biography.name: Stuart Laing

biography.bio: Granville Saxton was born in 1948 in Derby, Derbyshire, England. He is an actor, known for Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1 (2010), Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2 (2011) and The Eagle (2011). He has been married to Joanna Monro since 2001.
biography.name: Granville Saxton

biography.bio: Born in London, with a Nigerian father, Nina trained at the Northern School of Contemporary Dance, and gained A-levels in Performing Arts. Soon she was appearing as Desdemona in "Othello", Olivia in "Twelfth Night" and Hermia in "A Midsummer Night's Dream", along with the title role in "Educating Rita". Joining the RSC, she played in "Henry V", "The White Devil", "The Learned Ladies" and "Herbal Bed", before moving to the National Theatre for "Anthony & Cleopatra" and "House and Garden", followed by "The Marriage of Figaro" at the Royal Exchange. On TV, Nina has appeared in "People Like Us", Teachers (2001), The Jury (2002), Jonathan Creek: The Three Gamblers (2000), Prime Suspect 2 (1992) - and many others. New projects include Serious and Organised: Human Trade (2003) with Martin Kemp and John Duttine, and Richard Curtis's new film Love Actually (2003) with Hugh Grant. She also appears in "The Vortex" at the Donmar Warehouse until February 2003.
biography.name: Nina Sosanya

biography.bio: Tat Whalley was born on January 12, 1975. He is an actor and writer, known for The Messenger: The Story of Joan of Arc (1999), Colin (2008) and Hysteria: The Def Leppard Story (2001).
biography.name: Tat Whalley
